channel.title: Nitobi's Enterprise AJAX Podcast
channel.description: Stories and information on building high performance and highly usable web applications using AJAX and other RIA techniques. This techie content is mixed with bits and bites of the challenges of growing a software company. Main podcasters are Andre Charland and Dave Johnson from eBusiness Applications. More info at http://nitobi.com
channel.itunes:author: Andre Charland
channel.itunes:summary: Stories and information on building high performance and highly usable web applications using AJAX and other RIA techniques. Regular podcasters are Andre Charland, Dave Johnson and Alexei White of eBusiness Applications.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Building highly usable and performant AJAX interfaces.

item.title: Enterprise Ajax 18 - JavaOne
item.description: Andre Charland of Nitobi stopped by the Adobe booth at JavaOne and we got a chance to talk Ajax, Apollo and the future of the web. If you’re not familiar with Nitobi, they have some amazing Ajax components, an experienced development shop, and a new book on the way called ““. My first exposure to Nitobi was from an example they did that tied their grid control to Adobe Ajax Data Services (now LiveCycle Data Services). You don’t get much more cutting edge than that!
item.itunes:summary: Andre Charland of Nitobi stopped by the Adobe booth at JavaOne and we got a chance to talk Ajax, Apollo and the future of the web. If you’re not familiar with Nitobi, they have some amazing Ajax components, an experienced development shop, and a new book on the way called ““. My first exposure to Nitobi was from an example they did that tied their grid control to Adobe Ajax Data Services (now LiveCycle Data Services). You don’t get much more cutting edge than that!
item.itunes:subtitle: Enterprise Ajax 18 - JavaOne

item.title: Enterprise Ajax 17 - ApolloCamp and AjaxWorld
item.description: Andre Charland and Ryan Steward chat about the these two events.
item.itunes:summary: Andre Charland and Ryan Steward chat about the these two events.
item.itunes:subtitle: Enterprise Ajax 17 - ApolloCamp and AjaxWorld

item.title: Enterprise Ajax 16 - Component Design, Offline Ajax, Apollo
item.description: New Nitobi Components: Tree, Tab, Date Picker, Input masks. Offline Ajax. Apollo. Enterprise Ajax Book.
item.itunes:summary: New Nitobi Components: Tree, Tab, Date Picker, Input masks. Offline Ajax. Apollo. Enterprise Ajax Book.
item.itunes:subtitle: Enterprise Ajax 16 - Component Design, Offline Ajax, Apollo

item.title: Enterprise Ajax 15 - OpenAjax, AjaxWorld, Testing
item.description: OpenAjax Alliance, AjaxWorld, Testing, Debugging, Performance
item.itunes:summary: OpenAjax Alliance, AjaxWorld, Testing, Debugging, Performance
item.itunes:subtitle: Enterprise Ajax 15 - OpenAjax, AjaxWorld, Testing

item.title: Enterprise Ajax 14 - Nitobi - Ajax and Analysts
item.description: Discussin of Nitobi Grid 3.2, some javascript stuff, launching software and software industry analysts.
item.itunes:summary: Discussin of Nitobi Grid 3.2, some javascript stuff, launching software and software industry analysts.
item.itunes:subtitle: Enterprise Ajax 14 - Nitobi - Ajax and Analysts

item.title: Enterprise Ajax #13 - JavaScript Inheritance
item.description: Dave, Alexei and Andre talk about JavaScript inheritance techniques and how they affect performance. Followed by a discussion of useful Ajax use cases for business applications such as CRM.
item.itunes:summary: Dave, Alexei and Andre talk about JavaScript inheritance techniques and how they affect performance. Followed by a discussion of useful Ajax use cases for business applications such as CRM.
item.itunes:subtitle: Enterprise Ajax #13 - JavaScript Inheritance

item.title: Enterprise AJAX # 12
item.description: Andre, Dave and Alexei shoot the breeze about the new Nitobi website, BarCamp Vancouver, online apps like Google Apps.
item.itunes:summary: Andre, Dave and Alexei shoot the breeze about the new Nitobi website, BarCamp Vancouver, online apps like Google Apps.
item.itunes:subtitle: Enterprise AJAX # 12

item.title: Enterprise Ajax Episode 11 - Opensource
item.description: Andre Charland, Dave Johnson and Alexei White discuss Ajax Components, Software Documentation and open source frameworks. There's also a good discussion on where the real value comes from in a software component.
item.itunes:summary: Andre Charland, Dave Johnson and Alexei White discuss Ajax Components, Software Documentation and open source frameworks. There's also a good discussion on where the real value comes from in a software component.
item.itunes:subtitle: Enterprise Ajax Episode 11 - Opensource

item.title: Enterprise AJAX Epsisode # 10
item.description: Andre and Dave discuss JavaScript programming techniques and patterns such as inheritance, multiple inheritance, observer patterns and more. We also touch on the nonesense around Ajax security risks. Mentions also of BarCamp Vancouver and we're hiring at Nitobi! Until next week on the same bat channel at the same bat time:)
item.itunes:summary: Andre and Dave discuss JavaScript programming techniques and patterns such as inheritance, multiple inheritance, observer patterns and more. We also touch on the nonesense around Ajax security risks. Mentions also of BarCamp Vancouver and we're hiring at Nitobi! Until next week on the same bat channel at the same bat time:)
item.itunes:subtitle: Enterprise AJAX Epsisode # 10

item.title: Nitobi Enterprise Ajax - Episode 8
item.description: Dave and Andre discuss the new Nitobi name and brand, WebVisions 2006, Ajax Patterns with Michael Mahemoff, Geoweb with Ajax and GIS, Ajaxworld and the 3 pillars of Ajax.
item.itunes:summary: Dave and Andre discuss the new Nitobi name and brand, WebVisions 2006, Ajax Patterns with Michael Mahemoff, Geoweb with Ajax and GIS, Ajaxworld and the 3 pillars of Ajax.
item.itunes:subtitle: Nitobi Enterprise Ajax - Episode 8

item.title: EBA's Enterprise AJAX Podcast - Episode #8 - Hosted by DaveO
item.description:
DaveO gets a lesson on using AJAX (not just for cleaning) for advanced web interface usability from the brilliant and humourous lads of eBusiness Applications, Andre Charland and Alexei White.
Note: This is an 'enhanced' podcast filled with relevant photos and links (use your viewer window in the bottom left corner of iTunes).
item.itunes:summary:
DaveO gets a lesson on using AJAX (not just for cleaning) for advanced web interface usability from the brilliant and humourous lads of eBusiness Applications, Andre Charland and Alexei White.
Note: This is an 'enhanced' podcast filled with relevant photos and links (use your viewer window in the bottom left corner of iTunes).

item.title: EBA Enterprise AJAX Podcast # 6 Accessiblity
item.description: AJAX and accessibility discucsion. Topics include Section 508, screen readers, different disabilities and other RIA technologies such as Flex.

item.title: EBA's Enterprise AJAX Podcast - Episode #5 - SOA and Flex
item.description: Discussion of AJAX and how it relates to SOA and Flex with Andre Charland, Dave Johnson, Alexei White and Duane Nickull.

item.title: EBA's Enterprise AJAX Podcast - Episode #4
item.description: Andre Charland, Dave Johnson and Alexei White of eBusiness Applications are joined by Michael Mahemoff of AjaxPatterns.org. In this Episode we discsuss building Ajax to last, offline Ajax, declarative markup and the Open AJAX Alliance.
item.itunes:summary: Andre Charland, Dave Johnson and Alexei White of eBusiness Applications are joined by Michael Mahemoff of AjaxPatterns.org. In this Episode we discsuss building Ajax to last, offline Ajax, declarative markup and the Open AJAX Alliance.

item.title: EBA’s Enterprise AJAX Podcast - Episode #2 - APIs, Lawsuits
item.description: Andre Charland, Dave Johnson and Alexei White discuss a number of current topics including: -Yahoo API’s versus Google versus eBay APIs -Windows Live Mail -Translating higher level languages to Javascript -Enterprise AJAX - the book we’re writing -Podcasting with cote and charles about enterprise AJAX on Thursday -Java and AJAX -EBA Grid 3.05 Release
item.itunes:summary: Andre Charland, Dave Johnson and Alexei White discuss a number of current topics including: -Yahoo API’s versus Google versus eBay APIs -Windows Live Mail -Translating higher level languages to Javascript -Enterprise AJAX - the book we’re writing -Podcasting with cote and charles about enterprise AJAX on Thursday -Java and AJAX -EBA Grid 3.05 Release
item.itunes:subtitle: EBA’s Enterprise AJAX Podcast - Episode #2 - APIs, Lawsuits

item.title: Rich AJAX Grid Screencast
item.description: Screencast of the EBA Grid. Looking at rich AJAX features such inline editing, live scrolling, copy and paste and real-time saving. Screencast by Andre Charland, President of eBusiness Applications.
item.itunes:summary: Screencast of the EBA Grid. Looking at rich AJAX features such inline editing, live scrolling, copy and paste and real-time saving. Screencast by Andre Charland, President of eBusiness Applications.
item.itunes:subtitle: Rich AJAX Grid Screencast

item.title: EBA's Enterprise AJAX Podcast - Episode #1 - JavaOne
item.description:
Andre Charland and Dave Johnson, founders of eBusiness Applications Ltd., discuss the events at the AJAX Experience, DCamp, NetBeans Day and JavaOne. But most importantly the much awaited EBA Grid V3 launch!
More info: www.ebusinessapps.com
item.itunes:summary:
Andre Charland and Dave Johnson, founders of eBusiness Applications Ltd., discuss the events at the AJAX Experience, DCamp, NetBeans Day and JavaOne. But most importantly the much awaited EBA Grid V3 launch!
More info: www.ebusinessapps.com
